so whats the problem

and btw my 508 HD client path is

@echo off java loader

and thats my path

BUT MY SOURCE WORKS FINE, IT SET TO MY JDK VERSION SO YEH ITS FINE

ITS ONLY THE CLIENT I GOT PROBLEMS WITH

any help

i got jdk and jre installed

Heh I had his problem for a long time and no one would ever help. I find it funny how so many people offer help when you ask them xD

Good luck
[/quote]

Zach you made my day you hypocritical bitch.

You say you had this problem for a long time a very very very easy problem to fix

And yet in your signature you have that thing about the kid with the running server…
and you saying LMFAO.

Fuck off.[/quote]

Maybe you should fuck off you ignorant prat. All you did was post spam to flame.

i have jdk java and jre wtfff is the problem[/quote]

item.title: Seriosus java problem plzzzzzz clcik me!@@@!
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

on what your client or source?

if its your source then right click on runserver.bat and click edit.
then there should be something like C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin
change it to your version of jdk.
to find your version open my computer. at the top you should be able to type in a path.
if your using vista, just right click on where it says my computer and click edit address, or double click on the address bar.
type in C:\Program Files\Java
there should be a folder called jdk.
copy the folder name and change the jdk1.6.0_17 to the name of your folder.
save your run.bat and close it out and then try to run it.

Read full topic

item.title: Seriosus java problem plzzzzzz clcik me!@@@!
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

Right click your .bat file then press on edit and then replace the java path in there with your java path. if you have this version of java then take my path:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\java.exe”
